column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Huaihua
#Text=Huaihua ( 怀化 , Huáihuà ) is in western Hunan , southwestern China .
#Text=It is a prefecture-level city in a mountainous area with some rural poverty problems .
#Text=The city itself has a population around 400,000 , the prefecture as a whole 5 million .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The prefecture encompasses several autonomous ethnic counties , towns and villages .
#Text=Major ethnic groups found here are the Dòng or Kam ( 侗族 ) , Miáo or Hmong ( 苗族 ) , Tǔjiā ( 土家族 ) , and Yáo ( 瑶族 ) .
#Text=It was long inhabited by these ethnic group before the arrival of the Han Chinese more then a thousand years ago .
#Text=They are known to be indigenous to these mountainous areas .
#Text=They also inhabit neighboring Guizhou province .
#Text=By train
#Text=Huaihua is located on the Shanghai - Kunming railway line , which now host both fast and regular trains .
#Text=1 hour and a half by fast train and 5 to 9 hours on regular trains from Changsha .
#Text=1 hour and 15 minutes by fast train and 3 to 5 hours on regular trains to Kaili in Guizhou province .
#Text=Regular trains also go northwest towards Chongqing and it takes between 8 to 18 hours .
#Text=Check out schedules and journey time on 12306.com , because it can vary in an exaggerated way .
#Text=There are trains to Zhangjiajie as well .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Huaihua Zhijiang Airport ( HJJ ) .
#Text=Has flights from several cities in China .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The two train stations in the north and south of the city are connected via bus number 12 ( ~30 minutes ) .
#Text=See
#Text=Huaihua
#Text=City itself has nothing to offer a tourist .
#Text=All the main attractions and ethnic towns are out of the city , in Huaihua Prefecture , and can be reached by bus .
#Text=Tongdao Dong autonomous county ( 通道侗族自治县 ) .
#Text=Visit Kam people , whose language is a branch of the Tai-Kadai linguistic family .
#Text=A distant relative of the Thai people .
#Text=Jingzhou Miao and Dong Autonomous County ( 靖州苗族侗族自治县 ) .
#Text=Visit Hmong people , whose language is a branch of the Hmong-Mien linguistic family .
#Text=Hongjiang old commercial town ( 洪江古商城 ) .
#Text=A Ming dynasty town that flourished back in the old days .
#Text=Has a ancient brothel with waxwork figures and it explains a lot about the local lives back in imperial China .
#Text=Qianyang old town ( 黔阳古镇 ) .
#Text=The airport is of some historic importance — back in World War II it was known as Chihkiang Airfield and used by the U.S. air force .
#Text=Nowadays there 's a museum about the airport 's history .
#Text=World War II general Su Yu ( 粟裕 ) was born in Huitong County , and it 's possible to visit historic sites related to his life .
#Text=Do
#Text=Wanfu Mountain ( 万福山 Wànfúshān ) .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Pao Cai ( 泡菜 ) or pickled vegetables are found everywhere around the city .
#Text=It 's a must try if you are in this dusty city .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Fenghuang – well-preserved ancient town

#Text=Go east to Changsha , the provincial capital , west to Tongren(not to be confused with the one in Qinghai province ) or Kaili in Guizhou province , south to Guangxi Province or northwest to Chongqing .
#Text=From Chongqing or Changsha there are fast trains all over China .
#Text=A route popular with tourists is from Changsha to Guiyang and on to Kunming .
